tool.name: InflowECMWF

param.name: InputECMWF
param.dialogReference: The ECMWF (European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts) result of surface and subsurface runoff in netcdf-4 classic format. It is converted from grib format using the NCL (NCAR Command Language).

param.name: InputCatchment
param.dialogReference: The catchment feature class containing polygons each of which corresponds to a river reach segment with unique stream ID.

param.name: StreamID
param.dialogReference: The field of unique ID of the stream segment corresponding to the catchment.

param.name: OutputRAPIDInflowFile
param.dialogReference: The catchment-specific surface and subsurface water inflow in netcdf format that can be used as an input to RAPID.

param.name: EnsembleIndex
param.dialogReference: The index of the ECMWF ensemble(s) of which the surface and subsurface runoff used to calculate the water inflow within each catchment. By default (blank), the mean of all ensembles will be calculated for surface and surface runoff.

param.name: OutputWeightTable
param.dialogReference: The .csv table with each row specifying the Stream ID of the stream segment in each catchment, the geographic coordinates of the ECMWF grid point that contributes to the water inflow into the stream segment, and the contributing area and its proportion of the catchment area.

tool.summary: Creates RAPID netcdf input of water inflow with ECMWF surface and subsurface runoff results.
tool.usage:
• The input ECMWF result file must be of netcdf-4 classific (.nc4) format and converted from the .grib format using the NCL command "ncl_convert2nc".

  • The input catchment polygon feature class must contain an ID field with its corresponding stream IDs in the same order as in the RAPID input file of river network connecitivity.

  • After the input ECMWF is specified by user, all ensembles will be available for users to choose. By default (if left blank), the mean of all ensembles will be calculated for surface and subsurface runoff.

  • The output RAPID inflow file must be in netcdf format (.nc). It has one variable "m3_riv" with two dimensions: Time and Stream ID. The water inflow is in cubic meters.

  • The optional output table must be in .csv format. The first column is Stream ID; POINT_X, and POINT_Y are longitude and latitude; AREA_GEO is geodesic area (square meters) of the ECMWF grid point contribute to the catchment and Weight is the contributing area proportion.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates RAPID netcdf input of water inflow with ECMWF surface and subsurface runoff results.
